utilities

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.Database

  • public class Database
extends Object
    This class contains methods which interact with a SQL database using a JDBC driver.
    The class includes methods for:
    -setting up connection parameters
    -opening and closing a connection
    -preparing a statement
    -queries and updates (overloaded to accept both String commands and Prepared Statements)
    Author:
    Ville Salmela

    • Field Detail

      • connection

        private static Connection connection
        Holds the connection the database.

      • dbName

        private static String dbName
        The database name.

      • hostURL

        private static String hostURL
        The URL-address for the database server's root.
        For example 127.0.0.1

      • password

        private static String password
        User's password.

      • portNumber

        private static String portNumber
        Port number, which the database server listens.

      • username

        private static String username
        User name for the database. This user must have administrative privileges.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        private Database()
        This constructor is private, thus preventing the instantiation of this class.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public static void close()
        This method will close the connection.

      • init

        public static void init()
                 throws SQLException
        This method will create initial connection to the database server's root, for initializing the database.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.

      • isConnected

        public static boolean isConnected()
        This method will check, if the database is currently connected.
        Returns:
        true if JDBC connection is valid; false if connection is invalid.

      • open

        public static void open()
                 throws SQLException
        This method will open a connection to the database, which is set up using setup(String, String, String, String, String)
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.

      • prepare

        public static PreparedStatement prepare(String sql)
                                 throws SQLException
        This method will prepare a statement, using provided string and an active connection.
        Parameters:
        sql - A String containing the SQL-commands.
        Returns:
        A PreparedStatement.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.
        NullPointerException - if the connection is closed.

      • query

        public static ResultSet query(PreparedStatement statement)
                       throws SQLException
        This method will query the database using an active connection, and return the results.
        This method is overloaded, and there is also a version, which accepts a String as a parameter. See: query(String)

        This method uses two resources: a ResultSet and its Statement. Remember to close the Statement after invoking this method, this will also trigger the closing of ResultSet.

        Parameters:
        statement - A PreparedStatement which contains a precompiled SQL-statement.
        Returns:
        A ResultSet object that contains the data produced by the query; never null
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.

      • query

        public static ResultSet query(String sql)
                       throws SQLException
        This method will query the database using an active connection, and return the results.
        This method is overloaded, and there is also a version, which accepts a PreparedStatement as a parameter. See: query(PreparedStatement)

        This method uses two resources: a ResultSet and its Statement. Remember to close the Statement after invoking this method, this will also trigger the closing of ResultSet.

        Parameters:
        sql - A String which contains SQL-statement.
        Returns:
        A ResultSet object that contains the data produced by the query; never null
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.

      • setup

        public static void setup(String url,
                         String port,
                         String user,
                         String pass,
                         String db)
        This method will setup the connection parameters required to create a JDBC connection.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL-address for the database server's root. For example 127.0.0.1
        port - The port which the database server is listening. For example 3306
        user - User name for the database. This user must have administrative privileges.
        pass - User's password.
        db - Database name.

      • update

        public static int update(PreparedStatement statement)
                  throws SQLException
        This method will update the database using an active connection.
        This method is overloaded, and there is also a version, which accepts a String as a parameter. See: update(String)

        Remember to close the statement after it is no longer necessary.

        Parameters:
        statement - A PreparedStatement which contains a precompiled SQL-statement.
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.

      • update

        public static int update(String sql)
                  throws SQLException
        This method will update the database using an active connection.
        This method is overloaded, and there is also a version, which accepts a PreparedStatement as a parameter. See: update(PreparedStatement)

        This method will automatically close all resources it uses.

        Parameters:
        sql - A String which contains SQL-statement.
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.
